That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CSSS22-010, dated May 9, 2022 of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: a) That the presentation from Cathy Berges (Patient, Family, Caregiver Representative, Peterborough Ontario Health Team), Mark Graham (CEO, Canadian Mental Health Association Haliburton, Kawartha Pineridge; Peterborough Ontario Health Team Steering Committee member), Dr. Jackie Vanek (Physician), and Dr. Vanita Lokanathan (Primary Care Physician, Co-Lead Greater Peterborough Family Health Organization), be received for information; and b) That a letter of support be provided by the City to the Peterborough Ontario Health Team in support of its application to the province for annual funding in the amount of $7.6 million for a Community Health Centre, that will serve both the City and County of Peterborough.
e) That the city provide an additional capital grant, equivalent to the municipal fees for the project, up to an amount of $50,000, to be funded from the Capital Levy Reserve.

In response to the severe wind storm on May 21, 2022, that Schedule A of the User Fee Bylaw (21-113) be temporarily amended to suspend charges for receiving green waste only (tree branches and limbs) resulting directly from storm damage from the May 21, 2022 storm at the Peterborough County/City Waste Management Facility at 1260 Bensfort Road, Peterborough, ON, until June 30, 2022.

In response to the severe wind storm on May 21, 2022, that Schedule A of the User Fee Bylaw (21-113) be temporarily amended to suspend charges for receiving green waste only (tree branches and limbs) resulting directly from storm damage from the May 21, 2022 storm at the Peterborough County/City Waste Management Facility at 1260 Bensfort Road, Peterborough, ON, until June 30, 2022. a) Council directs Staff to allocate resources and equipment to manage and remove debris from private property that has been piled on residential boulevards as a result of the recent windstorm.  This work would commence once municipal resources have completed addressing the storm clean-up operations from City- owned trees in municipal rights-of-way, parks, open spaces and trails; and, b) That staff report back to Council on the costs incurred to date and on the delay of regular projects, in six weeks.

Whereas, when MP Singh visited Peterborough on May 10 th , he was subjected to behaviour that the vast majority of the community completely and unequivocally condemns, Whereas, regardless of political leanings, a cornerstone of a healthy, functioning democracy is to engage in civil discourse without personal attacks and without violent threats, Whereas, the Council for the City of Peterborough wishes all residents and visitors to our community to feel safe and welcomed, and to experience the generosity of spirit of the good people who live here, not the hateful actions of a few, Therefore, be it resolved that the Mayor’s Office, on behalf of City Council, send Mr. Singh a letter, inviting him to return to our community for a discussion and to demonstrate that the recent actions of a small group are not an accurate representation of the people of Peterborough.
